summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 between FBI personnel and SDNY prosecutors regarding the shipment of approximately 23 boxes of case records from two FBI case files (72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062) related to an investigation. It shows logistical coordination for evidence transfer.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Identified as a prosecutor working on the investigation, copied on the email chain coordinating the shipment of case record boxes from FBI files.

events.title: Initial coordination for case records shipment
events.description: Prosecutors from SDNY contact FBI to coordinate the shipment of approximately 23 boxes of papers from two FBI case files.

events.title: Boxes scheduled for shipment
events.description: An FBI agent confirms the boxes will be shipped via FedEx in the afternoon.

events.title: Follow-up on shipment status
events.description: Multiple follow-up emails are sent to verify the boxes were shipped, as FedEx tracking showed nothing inbound.

events.title: Confirmation of shipment
events.description: An FBI agent confirms the boxes shipped and will check the tracking number for status.

keyFacts: The document references two specific FBI case files: 72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062, with approximately 23 boxes of papers being shipped.
The email chain involves coordination between the FBI and prosecutors from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) in July 2019.
The correspondence indicates an active investigation requiring the physical transfer of case records as evidence.
Most names and email addresses in the document are redacted, showing only generic titles like 'Assistant U.S. Attorney' and FBI office designators.
The logistical urgency is implied by repeated follow-ups on the shipment status over a few days.
